DOC.brief_summary: Despite recent advance stent technology widespread application treatment peripheral vascular disease ( PVD ) , incidences partial complete blockage stent lumen ( in-stent restenosis ) due growth cell ( neo-intimal proliferation ) unacceptably high . In diabetic long superficial femoral artery ( SFA ) lesion , in-stent restenosis rate higher non-diabetics . Consequently interventional technique curtail in-stent restenosis explore . Cryoplasty stent expansion method balloon expand use pressurize nitrous oxide gas . As nitrous oxide expands balloon cool surroundings -10 degree C. This induce program death ( apoptosis ) smooth muscle cell arterial wall . The investigator hypothesize Cryoplasty , induce apoptotic smooth muscle cell response , apply post-dilation nitinol self-expanding stent Superficial Femoral Artery ( SFA ) diabetic , would lead decreased in-stent restenosis due decrease neointimal proliferation .
DOC.brief_title: Study Comparing Two Methods Expanding Stents Placed Legs Diabetics With Peripheral Vascular Disease
DOC.detailed_description: The pre-recruitment process would identify diabetic life-style limit claudication leg . Based physician decision patient may undergo peripheral vascular intervention SFA , placement self-expanding nitinol stent . If decision make , patient randomize either cryoplasty balloon post-dilation stent conventional angioplasty balloon post-dilation obtain informed consent . At one year , segment ( stent + 10 mm beyond proximal distal edge ) peak systolic velocity duplex ultrasound measure subject assess rate binary restenosis define > = 2.5 time increase peak systolic velocity ( primary endpoint ) . A 6 month rest ankle brachial index , binary restenosis may assess secondary endpoint study .
DOC.criteria: Diabetics , insulin noninsulin dependent 21 year age Able provide inform consent Life expectancy > 1 year Presenting moderate claudication ( Rutherford stage 2 ) , severe intermittent claudication ( Rutherford stage 3 ) , chronic critical limb ischemia pain patient rest ( Rutherford stage 4 ) , chronic critical limb ischemia ischemic ulcers/gangrene ( Rutherford stage 5/6 ) Placement > 5 mm diameter selfexpanding Nitinol stent SFA , least 1 vessel infrapopliteal runoff Placement > 60 mm length selfexpanding Nitinol stent SFA , least 1 vessel infrapopliteal runoff Serum creatinine > = 2.0 mg/dl Presence iodinate contrast allergy Presence allergy Aspirin Plavix Pregnancy Relative absolute contraindication anticoagulation History allergy Angiomax unfractionated heparin heparin induce thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) White blood count < 3000 ; platelet count < 100000 , baseline hemoglobin < 10 g/dl Absence brisk least 1 vessel infrapopliteal runoff foot Left ventricular ejection fraction < 25 % Relative absolute contraindication anticoagulation
